solution_line_template: In total, the {num_plants} tea leaf plants have {leaves_per_plant} x {num_plants} = <<{leaves_per_plant}*{num_plants}={total_initial_leaves}>>{total_initial_leaves} green leaves.
One-third of the yellow leaves falling off of all plants is {total_initial_leaves} / {fraction_denominator} = <<{total_initial_leaves}/{fraction_denominator}={leaves_fallen_off}>>{leaves_fallen_off}.
The number of remaining green leaves on the plants is {total_initial_leaves} - {leaves_fallen_off} = <<{total_initial_leaves}-{leaves_fallen_off}={remaining_green_leaves}>>{remaining_green_leaves}.
